issues.description: The problem statement and UML require a Lecture constructor that initializes all five attributes (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors) in that order. The template, however, provides a constructor with only three parameters (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents). This mismatch prevents students from implementing the constructor as specified and will cause confusion about the expected constructor signature and attribute initialization. The solution repository implements the five-parameter constructor matching the specification, so the template is inconsistent with both the problem statement and the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template Lecture class constructor to match the UML and problem statement by adding the missing parameters in the specified order. Change the constructor signature in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java to: public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors) { ... } and either leave the body as a TODO for students to implement or provide the same initialization as in the solution. Alternatively, if the intention was to have a 3-parameter constructor, update the problem statement and UML to reflect that design — but the simplest fix is to align the template with the stated specification.
